Getting a Reference to MapViews and SceneViews

The <esri-map-view> and <esri-scene-view> directives include function binding (events) as a way for you to get direct references to the underlying MapView and SceneView objects from a parent controller. They also can be registered with a service for access among different controllers. This will allow you to manipulate those objects in ways beyond what is allowed by the declarative directive API.

Events

The <esri-map-view> and <esri-scene-view> directives each include both on-create and on-load events that pass a reference to the underlying MapView or SceneView object to a callback function. The on-create event is fired immediately after the view has been created (i.e. new MapView()) and the on-load event fires after the view's promise has been resolved.

The <esri-map-view> and <esri-scene-view> directives also include an on-error event that passes the error information object if a view's promise has been rejected. This can be useful, for example, if you wish to use a <esri-scene-view> directive but need to gracefully handle browsers that do not support WebGL. Most examples using the <esri-scene-view> directive also demonstrate how to use this binding.

Registry

We've also included a registry service that you can use to get a direct reference to a MapView or SceneView object in any controller by setting the register-as attribute on the <esri-map-view> or <esri-scene-view> directive. See the Registry Pattern example.
